title: What is the connection between the Cro-Magnon race, the Tuatha dé Danann, and the Atlantean cycle?
first_phrase: The last 200 tokens of this text discuss the idea that the Cro-Magnon race was of a superior biological nobility. The author suggests that this race may have been related to the Tuatha dé Danann, a divine race from Irish mythology. The author also mentions the idea of "cross-contamination," which led to the degeneration of spirituality and tradition. It is important to distinguish the Hyperborean tradition from matriarchal cycles. For a more in-depth analysis, the reader is recommended to turn to Julius Evola's book, Revolt Against the Modern World.

last_phrase: In conclusion, it is important to distinguish the Hyperborean tradition from matriarchal or gynecocratic cycles, as the former represents the original spiritual tradition of our civilization. This confusion is prevalent in certain occultist circles and works, which underscores the need for readers to stay informed and clear on the subject. Additionally, it may be useful to replace the commonly held East-West opposition with North-South as a way of avoiding the degenerative influences that have led to misconceptions about our spiritual history.
